titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-852
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-852

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.Rabbīʾawwām ʾAkhṭar and Rathad[thawān ... ... sons] 2.of ʾAbīkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Saḥar [have dedicated to ʿAthta=] 3.r and Saḥar, the two lords of Nafqā(n) [... ...] 4.eight statues for the well-being of their two lords, [Dhamarʿalī Yu=] 5.habirr and his son Thaʾrān, the two kings of Saba[ʾ and Dhū-Raydān, and] 6.for the well-being of their (i.e. the kings’) two clients Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadtha(wān) [and the lineage of Dhū-] 7.Saḥar, and for the well-being of their households-the households of Dhū-[Saḥar, and] 8.for the well-being of their crops and their [har]vests from their entire property, 9.in every pl[ace, far] and near. And may 10.ʿAthtar [Saḥar g]rant them the esteem and] good-pleasure of th[eir] two lords, 11. Dhamarʿalī Yuhabirr and his son Thaʾrān, the two kings of [Sabaʾ] 12.[and Dhū-Ra]ydān. And may ʿAthtar and Saḥar aid and pro- 13.[tect] their two servants Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadthawān and the lineage of Dhū-Sa- 14.[ḥar and] their households and their crops from any harm 15.[and mali]ce, and the enmity and malevolence of any enemy, far or [near]. 16.[By ʿAth]tar and Hawbas and ʾĪlmuquh and by Dhāt-Ḥi- 17.[māyim and by Dhā]t-Buʿdānim and by ʿAthtar and Saḥar and by the (protective) sun-goddess of the 18.[king-Tanū]f-and by their (i.e. the dedicants’) two sun-goddesses, the mistresses of boundaries, [... ...] 19.their […] Yāsirān. And they have committed their dedications to ʿAthtar and Sa[ḥar].

And may ʿAthtar and Saḥar aid and pro- <lb n="13"/><supplied reason="lost">tect</supplied> their two servants Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadthawān and the lineage of Dhū-Sa- <lb n="14"/><supplied reason="lost">ḥar and</supplied> their households and their crops from any harm <lb n="15"/><supplied reason="lost">and mali</supplied>ce, and the enmity and malevolence of any enemy, far or <supplied reason="lost">near</supplied>. <lb n="16"/><supplied reason="lost">By ʿAth</supplied>tar and Hawbas and ʾĪlmuquh and by Dhāt-Ḥi- <lb n="17"/><supplied reason="lost">māyim and by Dhā</supplied>t-Buʿdānim and by ʿAthtar and Saḥar and by the <unclear>protective</unclear> sun-goddess of the <lb n="18"/><supplied reason="lost">king-Tanū</supplied>f-and by their <unclear>i.e. the dedicants’</unclear> two sun-goddesses, the mistresses of boundaries, <supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied> <lb n="19"/>their <supplied reason="lost">…</supplied> Yāsirān. div.tei:ab:
Rabbīʾawwām ʾAkhṭar and Rathadthawān sons
of ʾAbīkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Saḥar have dedicated to ʿAthta=
r and Saḥar, the two lords of Nafqān
eight statues for the well-being of their two lords, Dhamarʿalī Yu=
habirr and his son Thaʾrān, the two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, and
for the well-being of their i.e. the kings’ two clients Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadthawān and the lineage of Dhū-
Saḥar, and for the well-being of their households-the households of Dhū-Saḥar, and
for the well-being of their crops and their harvests from their entire property,
in every place, far and near. And may
ʿAthtar Saḥar grant them the esteem and good-pleasure of their two lords,
Dhamarʿalī Yuhabirr and his son Thaʾrān, the two kings of Sabaʾ
and Dhū-Raydān. And may ʿAthtar and Saḥar aid and pro-
tect their two servants Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadthawān and the lineage of Dhū-Sa-
ḥar and their households and their crops from any harm
and malice, and the enmity and malevolence of any enemy, far or near.
By ʿAthtar and Hawbas and ʾĪlmuquh and by Dhāt-Ḥi-
māyim and by Dhāt-Buʿdānim and by ʿAthtar and Saḥar and by the protective sun-goddess of the
king-Tanūf-and by their i.e. the dedicants’ two sun-goddesses, the mistresses of boundaries,
their … Yāsirān. And they have committed their dedications to ʿAthtar and Saḥar.

Rabbīʾawwām ʾAkhṭar and Rathadthawān sons
of ʾAbīkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Saḥar have dedicated to ʿAthta=
r and Saḥar, the two lords of Nafqān
eight statues for the well-being of their two lords, Dhamarʿalī Yu=
habirr and his son Thaʾrān, the two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, and
for the well-being of their i.e. the kings’ two clients Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadthawān and the lineage of Dhū-
Saḥar, and for the well-being of their households-the households of Dhū-Saḥar, and
for the well-being of their crops and their harvests from their entire property,
in every place, far and near. And may
ʿAthtar Saḥar grant them the esteem and good-pleasure of their two lords,
Dhamarʿalī Yuhabirr and his son Thaʾrān, the two kings of Sabaʾ
and Dhū-Raydān. And may ʿAthtar and Saḥar aid and pro-
tect their two servants Rabbīʾawwām and Rathadthawān and the lineage of Dhū-Sa-
ḥar and their households and their crops from any harm
and malice, and the enmity and malevolence of any enemy, far or near.
By ʿAthtar and Hawbas and ʾĪlmuquh and by Dhāt-Ḥi-
māyim and by Dhāt-Buʿdānim and by ʿAthtar and Saḥar and by the protective sun-goddess of the
king-Tanūf-and by their i.e. the dedicants’ two sun-goddesses, the mistresses of boundaries,
their … Yāsirān. And they have committed their dedications to ʿAthtar and Saḥar.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
